text:
Has anybody seriously tried to fix that bug, or if isn't a bug found a 
solution? I saw many people complaining about this error but nobody has fixed

as yuo can see it has the problem at certain time, after it goes away WITHOUT 
restart or touch anything, after it shows up again, what is the nature of this 
problem?? why it is able to work again after 3-4 hours, or after a little 
while??
Please note that everything is working fine from inside the LAN, running a ping 
when it is down from outside returns back. type the www address, NOT 
WORKING !?!?!? Type the IP address doesn't work as well when it is down.
PLEASE HELP, I DON'T WANT TO GO BACK TO M$-IIS, AND I HAVE TO IF THIS ERROR 
PERSIST.
THANK YOU.
creator: korfut@lycos.com
wrowe@apache.org
text:
See the many bugs duplicated into bug 8325 [sort of a master bug for all of
  the many flavors of this error.]

  Effectively, you have some software (antivirus, firewall, vpn or similar)
  that doesn't work correctly.  You might try the fix advertised in bug 8325.
  If that doesn't solve your problem, there is no way for us to work around
  the broker socket driver installed by the offending product.

  This is not an Apache bug but a bug in the other software that interferes
  with any socket-based program (the most similar MS product that is affected
  by such bugs is NetMeeting.)

  As far as the other errors in your logs, they are worms seeking an unsecured
  server [not yours.]


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 8325 ***
